A mixture of itaconic acid (1.3 g, 10 mmol) and p-chlorobenzylamine (1.28 ml, 11 mmol) was stirred at 120 °C for 4 hours. Thereafter, the solvent was evaporated off under reduced pressure, and the obtained crystals.
gold_antecedents: A mixture of itaconic acid (1.3 g, 10 mmol) and p-chlorobenzylamine (1.28 ml, 11 mmol)

context: A mixture of itaconic acid (1.3 g, 10 mmol) and p-chlorobenzylamine (1.28 ml, 11 mmol) was stirred at 120 °C for 4 hours. Thereafter, the solvent was evaporated off under reduced pressure, and the obtained crystals were washed with a mixed solution of acetic acid and hexane (1:9) to obtain the title compound (2.3 g, yield 92%).
gold_antecedents: A mixture of itaconic acid (1.3 g, 10 mmol) and p-chlorobenzylamine (1.28 ml, 11 mmol)
a mixed solution of acetic acid and hexane (1:9)

context: Similarly to example 1.8, starting from 66 mg (0.5 mmol) of 3-fluorophenylboronic acid and 150 mg (0.3 mmol) of 5-bromo-3-methyl-1-{2-oxo-2-[4-(2-oxo-1,4-dihydro-2H-quinazolin-3-yl)-piperidin-1-yl]-ethyl}-1H-pyrimidine-2,4-dione (prepared as described in example 2.5), 30 mg (20%) of 5-(3-fluorophenyl)-3-methyl-1-{2-oxo-2-[4-(2-oxo-1,4-dihydro-2H-quinazolin-3-yl)-piperidin-1-yl]-ethyl}-1H-pyrimidine-2,4-dione is obtained in the form of a white solid.
